title: The Last Legwoman: A Novel of Hollywood, Murder...and Gossip! (Meredith Ogden Hollywood Legwoman Mysteries Book 1)
features: World famous gossip columnist Bettina Grant has been murdered in her home office. Her legwoman/assistant Meredith Ogden is now caught up in the investigation, skirting its danger and trying to manage its chaos. Who killed the columnist? What was the motive? Why is a well-known talk show host threatening Meredith? Who broke into her apartment? What will Meredith’s future be in show business with Bettina gone? “High profile” Investigator T.K. Raymond, and an unlikely cast of colorful characters step in to help Meredith navigate through the perilous waters to find answers.
description: "Penny Pence Smith was active for years in reporting on the entertainment industry and her expertise shows. She's written an engrossing crime story set in the intriguing world of movie stars and its gossip.
is a perfect setting for a mystifying murder and I could hardly put the book down." Gary Hickling Author,

is a savory first noel, a fresh surprise about an untimely murder in the Hollywood landscape, a puzzling mystery with twists and turns, and a fascinating tour of how the professional gossip world works. Penny Pence Smith's characters hold on to you. You find yourself wanting to reach out and help protagonist Meredith Ogden over the dangerous and threatening ground she must cover in her quest for the truth."
Angel Hero Murder in Hawaii: A True Story
"Dr. Penny Pence Smith not only knows how to tell a story, it feels like she lives the world she writes about in
Last Legwoman: A novel of Hollywood, murder and gossip
. It's an amazing mystery and an unreal journey into the world of show business!"

Penny Pence Smith began writing during high school for the Indio Daily News, received a Communication and journalism B.A. at University of Washington, MA from Annenberg School at University of Southern California, and Ph.D. from University of North Carolina-Chapel Hill. She was a Warner Communication movie magazine editor, correspondent/LA Bureau Manager for New York Times Special Features Syndicate covering the entertainment industry, Hawaii Correspondent for The Hollywood Reporter, and author of best-selling tourism books. She managed advertising, public relations agencies and marketing consulting firms then became a professor at UNC Chapel Hill and Hawaii Pacific University. Current work appears in Sun City News & Views in Palm Desert, Ca., and in Hopper (Mokulele Airlines magazine), and in-room books for SPG Hotels (Hoku) and Alohilani Resort.
